III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
1

Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member allowed a youth to use their cellphone to access
social media and contact relatives around 1/29/25.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 05/06/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A denied using a staff’s cell phone to
contact her sister through a staff’s Instagram account. Youth A
also denied requesting a staff to reach her sister through
Instagram messaging.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately on 05/15/2025
at Wayne County Juvenile Detention. Youth B and Youth C stated
they have never seen a staff use their personal cell phone on the
unit or elsewhere in the facility. Youth B and Youth C also denied
ever seeing a youth use a staff’s personal cell phone.
Former Staff (FS) resigned from Wayne County Juvenile
Detention in 03/2025. Attempts to interview FS by phone were
made on 05/15/2025, 05/21/2025 and 05/23/2025. A return call
was not received.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/8/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated she primarily works on the female units.
Staff 1 stated she never witnessed a staff use their personal cell
phone on the unit or allow a youth to use their personal cell
phone.
Youth A’s Sister (YS) was interviewed on 05/06/2025 by phone.
YS stated she received an Instagram message from FS stating
she was one of the “guards” at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
and asked for her phone number. YS stated she asked FS if she
was contacted on behalf of Youth A and did not receive a reply.
YS stated she did not provide FS with her cell phone number
because she had cell phone service issues. YS stated this was
her only contact with FS. YS forwarded a screen shot of her
contact with FS and stated FS deleted the initial message sent by
FS.
2

Documentation
Screenshot of FS Instagram message states FS and YS do not
follow each other, but they follow two mutual people. There are no
messages from FS on the screen shot. YS messaged FS back on
01/20/2025 with “I am did you get my page from her?” and “Ok
give me a second”.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 I states “Staff shall not encourage, engage in or
fraternize with any resident who received services by the Juvenile
Detention Facility (JDF), while on or off duty. There will be no
conduct, whether on or off the job, that adversely affects the
employee’s ability to perform his/her current job or which
adversely affects the Institution’s ability to carry out its assigned
mission. Staff will under no circumstances share personal
information. Staff will under no circumstances take pictures or
videos of residents.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because the Instagram
message does not identify Youth A, and it is inconclusive what the
nature of the contact was between FS and YS. In addition, Youth
A denied requesting FS to reach out to YS on Youth A’s behalf
and denied using FS’s phone.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
